page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN NEWICK
page.content: Transport in the early part of this century, in the Newick area was by rail or by road.On the roads one either walked or rode a bicycle, drove a horse-drawn vehicle or one of the recently invented motorcars. Today, the East Grinstead to Lewes railway is no longer in existence. It was closed in 1958. There are two bus services, running hourly, one from Haywards Heath to Uckfield and the other from Newick to Lewes. Most families own a car, making London an hour away and the coast a mere half hour journey. Good motorway systems are also fairly accessible. The River Ouse, once navigable by barges as far as Newick, is now only a haunt for anglers. Air travellers need only travel about 20 miles to Gatwick Airport, one of London's major airports.
